alert.note: Alert for Tallapoosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 12 at 1:34PM CST until January 12 at 2:15PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: The National Weather Service in Birmingham has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Central Tallapoosa County in east central Alabama... * Until 215 PM CST. * At 133 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Western Lake Martin to near Eclectic to near Santuck, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Dadeville, Camp Hill, Jacksons` Gap, Martin Dam, Eastern Lake Martin, Western Lake Martin, Southern Lake Martin, Still Waters Resort, Northern Lake Martin, Susannah Crossing, Maxwell Gunter Recreation Area, Blue Creek Marina, Dare Park, Reeltown and Yates Reservoir. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 PM CST for east central Alabama. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 500 PM CST for east central Alabama. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 600 PM CST for east central Alabama. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
